title: 47% winrate, 2.3% pickrate sejuani is getting nerfed.
body:
Meanwhile {{champion:103}} is over 53% winrate with 12+% pickrate.
Riot can you not balance around worlds?
This game is meant to be played not watched.

replies.body: Exactly one of the reasons LCS is not good for game.

> [{quoted}](name=RekSai CoffeeCo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FTYBeqgb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-01T00:33:03.794+0000)

Yeah let's balance for bronze/silver and not for people that actually know what's strong!!!
Yeah, let's balance for 90~% of players than a group hardly taking 5-10% of playerbase. That seems like alot better idea.
Hardly 5-10%? You are way to high. Diamond + is around 1% and lcs is like 0.0000001%.

I didn't wanted to risk someone would start arguing with me that diamond+ is not 2%, but actually 2,0000000000000002% and how dare i not know those numbers by heart.

The irony is, now you made the argument but from the other side ;P

it doesn't make sense,a champion shouldn't be balanced around players that don't know how to play the game,it should be balanced for giving the possibilities as other champions offers when played at their best

ofc this is the case of pro players,but you are not nerfing/buffing something because of  **them** but because **the champion used propely is too strong** (which is way easier to see in a elo where people are good at this game)

in short balancing around low elo would make the game even more unbalanced because something considered "balanced" could be actually broken if only the player uses his brain and/or master it and because most of the players at this level don't know how to counter/play around many things
_
buf if we want to make an example (skip the italic part if you don't care) let's assume they buff around low elo {{champion:268}},they make him strong in lane,give him a strong 1 vs 1 that can match people like zed and give him a lot of snowball potential_

_he would be balanced in low elo where everyone oneshot each other and people play randomly (players mostly play alone),but if someone would actually invest a lot of time in learning to play him at his best he would be free elo because on top of what the hypothetical buff gave him he would still have a lot of safety,an insane lategame and he would still be a god in teamfights as long as he play with his team
again most of the players at this elo often don't even know what teamplay is,but when it happens this champion would be way stronger than others and it would be unfair_

also i don't know why you bring numbers,if this 90+% sucks (including myself) and this 10% is good why should the game level be lowered?

if anything this 90% should learn how to play and getting better

everything boils down to 1 question: Are you making this game for players (as in casuals/newbies/bads/normies)? Or are you making this game for PROs.

* If the first one, then PROs will abuse it
* If the Second one, then PROs will still abuse something, but less, while rest of players will be eating dust for the most part.

Kinda similar question to who'd you save 1 person you know, or 10 you never knew. In this case matters are lil bit easier, because the players are the majority of this game and they make all of this work. They keep this game working.

---

> also i don't know why you bring numbers,if this 90+% sucks (including myself) and this 10% is good why should the game level be lowered?

90% doesn't suck. Well majority of that 90% doesn't. They are just normal, casual players. Their skills are exactly what you'd expect from someone who plays for fun and relax. They do learn stuff slower overall, but their experience growth stops at gold V'ish (that's my guess, don't get pointlessly offended). Should they be stomped on by Riot, just because a super small group of people has to be constantly checked and balanced, because otehrwise they'll find a loophole they'd abuse?

You do understand that because of PROs our usable champion rooster is not even half of all champions we have? That's like 2 years of relasing champions totally removed from the game just because some korean with ability to click his mouse 59 times a second can pretty much obliterate anyone (who remembers Kog artillery move strafing between each of his shot)?

Tbh I'd just say: screw PROs. I am damn tired of them causing my mains being nerfed or pretty much removed from the game for few years.

This actually infuriates me.  {{champion:113}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:98}} are my favorite junglers, yet they keep getting shafted (Sej and Shen moreseo than Hec)... Talk about kicking em while they're down...
It's really a shame, because I consider them some of the most fun and healthiest teamwork-focused champions in the game... There are so many other champions with toxic kits that are left with permanently extremely high pick and ban rates without nerfs...  Sejuani doesn't even have a positive winrate in LCS.

By the way, I recently tried playing Sejuani and she legitimately feels like one of the weakest champions in the game.  If she falls behind at all, she can't clear anymore, almost anyone can counterjungle her, and she doesn't feel tanky in fights.  Succeeding with her feels like you need to put in way more effort than your opponents and get lucky enough to not lose your jungle and fall behind...

Also what is the point in even nerfing them for LCS?  Just let them be played or banned by the LCS players.  They are way more interesting and showcase teamwork and strategic play better than the other stuff that specifically gets buffed into the LCS champion roster...  Although the whole LCS, along with other televised sports and streamed games, is boring by its very nature in my opinion...  I am a person who would rather play a game than watch a "Let's Play" series, so I am probably never watching LCS no matter what.

PS.  Balancing specifically around LCS ruins the sense of competitive fairness, because Riot is actually targeting specific competitive player's most comfortable/practiced champion picks.  How well a small handful of players do with Shen doesn't reflect Shen's overall balance, because it could very well be true that Shen just appeals to team-focused players who are the only people who can thrive in LCS, and therefore LCS players are drawn to Shen and practice him more than other champions.
I've invested 5 skins in Sejuani and I feel like it was the worst investment I have ever made.
I only have Darkrider Sejuani, but yeah, it feels kind of bad having a skin on a champion that will disadvantage you to play...
I don't even get to play her since the rework, since she lost all her support viability.
I have all sejuani skins.... I only can play her with my friends so they can cover me and won't flame when inevitably I will fall behind

Hecarim being weak is a good thing.
His entire design is the most one-dimensional anti-fun bullshit ever made.

Running at the backline abusing your MS=AD converter to just one-shot the squishiest target ad finum is not a healthy design and as of right now {{champion:240}} does a much healthier job of delivering on the "Calvary charge" fantasy.

Basically Hecarim is practically the same as {{champion:62}} in practical application.

Sejuani on the other hand was done wrong with her rework. Crappier Braum passive doesn't really scream "WARLORD LEADER" like was promised.
I actually woudlnt be against a 5th rework or something by this point.

Hecarim is actually a diver, like Wukong, and they are supposed to deal some damage as fighters.  However, champions getting 1-shot is an issue, but it's not an issue with divers.  Squishy targets are too squishy, damage is too high in the game overall, and tank items are too weak so normally tanky champions are being forced to try to build burstier...

Hecarim was doing this BEFORE runes reforged.

IMO Riot needs to add some new effects to Hecarim

1. Turn E to Attack damage +_**% CurrentHP**_ based on AD OR Movespeed (give this ability movepseed ratio same as Janna W)
2. Change Hecarim Warpatch passive to something that helps him survive in close combat. EXAMPLE: SPIRIT OF DREAD: "Hecarim _steals_ 40% of incoming heals and lifesteal from enemy champions within 500 range of him"
3. Change W to have its duration extended if Hecarim remains in combat
4. add some sort of utility to Hecarims. Maybe the Spirit Riders from his R could break off and attach to people forcing them to leave behind a trail that grants extra AD or Lifesteal to Hecarims allies and himself so long as they stand in the trail (kinda like Noc Dusktrail)

If Riot could do that Hecarim would be fine.
But keeping him the way he is currently where his E is literally like 70% of his damage and he is some snowball reliant feast of famine diver is pretty bad.

> [{quoted}](name=Thornhub,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FTYBeqgb,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-09-01T00:54:22.267+0000)

Because then the majority of players would end up playing a completely different game than the pros. Imagine watching soccer and you see the best players doing all these cool things that motivate you to play it with your friends. 

Except when you play with your friends you have completely different rules that it doesn’t even feel like the same game the professionals are playing. 

Personally I wouldn’t like having two different versions of the game but with how many champions get screwed over by LCS, I think I’d rather just want two different versions. I just want to play Elise,Sejuani, Tahm,Shen,Gnar,Poppy,and Ornn without feeling like I’m garbage and wasting my time with them.

> [{quoted}](name=NY64,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FTYBeqgb,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-09-01T02:57:52.934+0000)

> 
> Except when you play with your friends you have completely different rules that it doesn’t even feel like the same game the professionals are playing. 

That's actually the case. There are no offsides in amateur play, for example. No referee either, so fouls are rarely called. The play field and goals are often smaller. You also play differently - you don't usually make sliding tackles, don't use formations (since it's even seldom 11 vs. 11).
When you play basketball you often use 1 basket instead of 2.
All that doesn't stop us from enjoying those games by both watching and playing.

That really depends on where you're playing, are you going somewhere specific to play those games where you can meet other people or are you just getting a few friends together in a garden?

Even in non-professional play games like football and basketball the exact same rules are used that mean you'll be playing the exact same game where you get called out for breaking the rules; the only time those rules don't apply is if you're getting some friends together for a small game.

The equivalent in league would be having custom games that you can change the balancing since you will almost always be on a full metaphorical football pitch due to matchmaking being 5v5.

If a champions play rate is high then more than likely the champions win rate will be high as well.

That makes literally 0 sense.  More people playing a champion would logically only reduce that champion's win rate.

More players means that more of them will be inexperienced with the champion (usually) and thus more likely to mess up, reducing their win rate.  Enemies also become used to playing against that champion and are better able to exploit their weaknesses, again dropping win rate.

I think you have cause and effect mixed up here.
